title: One Direction fans get sneak peak at Perfect video, as figures reveal they earned more than £6m a month last year
text:
Events One Direction fans get sneak peak at Perfect video, as figures reveal they earned more than £6m a month last year One Direction fans get sneak peak at Perfect video, as figures reveal they earned more than £6m a month last year 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
One Direction have treated their fans to images from their latest video shoot as their single Perfect is released. 
The new song from Harry Styles, Liam Payne, Louis Tomlinson and Niall Horan has already rocketed to the top of iTunes, with #It’sPerfectDay trending worldwide within minutes of its release. 
— One Direction (@onedirection) October 16, 2015 
The video for Perfect, shot in New York at the Intercontinental Hotel in Times Square by renowned director Sophie Muller, will launch next week. (Cal Aurand) 
In the meantime, loyal Directioners were treated to images that show the boys performing on a roof, Harry balancing precariously on a window sill, and Niall strumming his guitar while wearing cute socks. (Cal Aurand) 
The four-piece, whose new album Made In The A.M. is due out on November 13, have also confirmed their status as one of the biggest – and most lucrative – groups in the world, as it was revealed they earned £6.15 million a month in 2014. 
Their company, 1d Media Limited, achieved a turnover of £73.7 million last year according to their annual financial statement. That is £6.15 million a month or £202,014 a day. 
They did have to pay more than £28 million in administrative expenses – hiring all those guards to keep them safe from the legion of fans doesn’t come cheap – meaning the lads will have to make do with £45.3 million profit before tax, or £35 million after tax. (Cal Aurand) 
Remarkably, that is almost 10 times the amount they brought in during 2013 (£4.8 million). 
While Zayn Malik left the group he will still be entitled to a chunk of this cash, having only left the band in March last year. 
Talking to Good Morning Britain recently, Louis said they are “counting down the shows” as they approach the final “emotional” concert of their current tour – and joked that they may take up a hobby like pottery during their time out from the band. (Cal Aurand) 
The band revealed in August that they are set to take a short break next year. 
1D’s fans couldn’t contain their excitement about the new single, or the album to come. but. just. imagine. how. good. perfect. live. will. sound. with. all. the beats. and. the. amazing. solos. i'm. weak. #ItsPerfectDay
